Author: dpapathanasiou
Content:
Google comes close (from Paul Tyma's blog):

"At Google, you never know who your interviewers are going to be. If you say you're a Java or C++ expert that rates a 10 - you darn well better be - because you never know - your next interviewer could be Josh Bloch, Matt Austern, Guido van Rossum, or Ken Thompson."

http://paultyma.blogspot.com/2007/03/howto-pass-silicon-valley-software.html

Author: dpapathanasiou
Content: John, good luck with this project, regardless of which concept you use.

Author: davidw
Content: Having recently relocated to Innsbruck (from Padova, Italy, and originally from Oregon in the US), I'm curious about utilizing an LLP from the UK.  I'd be really interested to hear if anyone has more information on that, because as things stand, starting a company in countries like Austria or Italy is absurdly expensive.
